comments.body:
[~unni],

Could you provide us with the following information:

* layout of your Eucalyptus cloud (i.e. is it HA, non-HA, which machines are the CLC, Walrus, SC, CC, NC, etc.)
* Logs from the CLC and SC when you issue the euca-create-volume command

Let us know if you have any questions.  Look forward to hearing from you soon.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Hello Harold,

      Thanks for signing up this bug.Please read the bug title as "Volume
failed to attach"

I found m bug is the replication of
https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-4021 and is fixed .Please let
me know how can I update the patch.

Regards,
Unni.



On Thu, Jan 10, 2013 at 1:23 AM, Harold Spencer (JIRA) <

Hi [~unni],

The error message in EUCA-4021 was the following:

{code}
....
libvirt: internal error unable to execute QEMU command '__com.redhat_drive_add': Device 'drive-virtio-disk5' could not be initialized (code=1)
...
{code}

The error message that you are reporting shows the following error:

{code}
....
libvirt: internal error unable to execute QEMU command '__com.redhat_drive_add': Duplicate ID 'drive-virtio-disk1' for drive (code=1)
...
{code}

Based upon that error, it seems like the issue that follows close to what you are experiencing can be found in EUCA-3624.  What would be really helpful here is if we could get the information above.  This way, it will help pinpoint what the exact issue is here.  Regarding information on submitting patches, please refer to the following link:

http://www.eucalyptus.com/participate/code/contribute

I hope this helps.  Please let me know if you have any additional questions.  Look forward to getting the information requested so that we can begin investigating this issue. 

Thanks and have a wonderful day.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Hello Harold,

 Thanks for the reply dude.Here is the details of my setup.
   
  Eucalyptus 3.2 (updated from 3.1.2) in NON-HA with CLC,Walrus,SC,CC are in a single box (Hp server with Centos 6.4)

Two NC,both are Hp servers with Centos 6.4.

Eucalyptus mode :MANAGED-NOVLAN 

When I tried to attach the volume to a running instance of centos it is attaching but the device isn't showing up in the instance,even for the root user also,so i detached the volume and attached it again and this resulted a failure resulting the below logs.

Hi [~unni],

Thanks for the information.  My apologies for not asking this earlier, but could you change the log level to DEBUG on your cloud?  There shouldn't be a need to restart any of the components.  For information regarding how to change this, please refer to the [Log Files section of the 3.2 Administrator Guide|http://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/3.2/ag/ts_logs.html].  In short, below is how to change the logging configuration:

* run euca-modify-property -p cloud.euca_log_level=DEBUG
* on the NC(s), edit the LOGLEVEL parameter in eucalyptus.conf file, and change it to DEBUG

Thanks again for doing this. Afterwards, please send us the logs again.  Sorry for the confusion.  Thanks again for working with us on this.  Look forward to hearing from you soon.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Hi Harold,

  Please find the attached log files.

Regards
Unni.

Thanks [~unni],

I will be traveling the next couple of days, but will be looking into this issue more here later this week.  Thanks again for the information.  

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.

Take you own time to solve it buddy...Thanks a lot for handling this issue.

Regards,
Unni.

On Mon, Jan 21, 2013 at 10:45 PM, Harold Spencer (JIRA) <

Hey [~Unni],

This has been confirmed.  Thanks for reporting this issue. Follow this ticket to see when this issue gets resolved by a git commit.  Thanks so much for your patience.

Cheers,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
The reporter confirmed that this was a duplicate of a closed bug.
Closing Resolved issues for released versions of the software.
